definition: consecutive defeats/to lose several times in a row
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: They have had good streaks and they have had bad streaks.
sentences.chinese: 他們既有連勝也有連敗。

sentences.english: He also lost four in a row to Andy Murray.
sentences.chinese: 與穆雷的對決，也是四陣連敗，無一勝蹟。

sentences.english: He broke a three-match losing streak in Rome last week and is hoping for better.
sentences.chinese: 上週在羅馬他擊破了三連敗魔咒，希望未來會更好。

sentences.english: LT: "Well it was great to finally break our losing streak."
sentences.chinese: 太好了，我們的球隊終於結束了連敗的情況。

sentences.english: Wow… after that bad streak right before Yao came back I figured JVG was out of contention.
sentences.chinese: 姚明回來前的連敗我以爲老範已經退出了競爭的行列。

sentences.english: The Sixers lost their first 15 games before beating the Houston Rockets.
sentences.chinese: 76人在擊敗休斯頓火箭之前他們開局15連敗。

sentences.english: Coach Lawrence Frank was fired at 0-16.
sentences.chinese: 主教練弗蘭克在16連敗的時候被炒了魷魚。

sentences.english: But two successive defeats Sharapova, the group only theoretically possible.
sentences.chinese: 而兩連敗的莎拉波娃，小組出線僅剩理論上的可能。

sentences.english: Persistent train refers to a fading streak of light that remains after the fireball has vanished.
sentences.chinese: 持久性訓練是指衰落連敗的光後剩下的火球已經消失。

sentences.english: Yet the losses keep coming, in spectacular fashion.
sentences.chinese: 然而連敗還在以一種壯觀的方式繼續。

sentences.english: We're heartened by United losing their last two games.
sentences.chinese: 曼聯遭遇兩連敗，我們受此鼓舞。
